content.raw: Image can't inherit from HeightmapData. It would be cleaner for HeightmapData to have multiple functions that fill heightmap data. One function for DEM, one for Image.
content.html: Image can't inherit from HeightmapData. It would be cleaner for HeightmapData to have multiple functions that fill heightmap data. One function for DEM, one for Image.

update.description:
Add DEM support into Gazebo. You can load any raster DEM file, as long as it's supported by GDAL. GDAL will be an optional Gazebo library.

On Ubuntu Saucy, Raring or Quantal:
   
```
#!c++

sudo apt-get install gdal-bin libgdal-dev libgdal1 python-gdal
```
On Ubuntu Precise:
   
```
#!c++

sudo apt-get install gdal-bin libgdal1-1.7.0 libgdal1-dev python-gdal
```

It depends on [this sdformat pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/67/element-used-by-dem-heightmaps/diff).

**Example world**

The example world loads a heightmap from a GeoTiff file. If the SDF element *<size>* is present, the DEM will be loaded in scaled mode. Scaled mode means that the terrain will be scaled according to the *<size>* values. In non-scaled mode the terrain is loaded using its real dimensions.


```
#!c++

gazebo sdf/worlds/heightmap_dem.world

```

**Test**

Unit test for Dem, and integration test for checking that it's working with the GPS sensor.

**Coverage**

Dem.cc has 100% function coverage and 81% condition coverage.

**Tutorial**

There's a new [DEM tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/3.0/gazebo_dem) for Gazebo 3.0.
update.title: DEM support

content.raw: it's a little strange to see `Image` inherit `HeightmapData`. Maybe in the future we can separate it out and have a subclass called `ImageHeightmapData` that inherits both `Image` and `HeightmapData`. If you think it sounds ok, I can create an issue to track this
content.html: it's a little strange to see Image inherit HeightmapData. Maybe in the future we can separate it out and have a subclass called ImageHeightmapData that inherits both Image and HeightmapData. If you think it sounds ok, I can create an issue to track this

content.html:
this function name is a little confusing:

update.description:
Add DEM support into Gazebo. You can load any raster DEM file, as long as it's supported by GDAL. GDAL will be an optional Gazebo library.

On Ubuntu Saucy, Raring or Quantal:
   
```
#!c++

sudo apt-get install gdal-bin libgdal-dev libgdal1 python-gdal
```
On Ubuntu Precise:
   
```
#!c++

sudo apt-get install gdal-bin libgdal1-1.7.0 libgdal1-dev python-gdal
```

It depends on [this sdformat pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/67/element-used-by-dem-heightmaps/diff).

**Example world**

The example world loads a heightmap from a GeoTiff file. The SDF element *<use_true_size>* can be modified to alternate between scaled mode or non-scaled mode. Scaled mode means that the terrain is scaled according to the *<size>* element. In non-scaled mode the terrain is loaded using its real dimensions.


```
#!c++

gazebo sdf/worlds/heightmap_dem.world

```

**Test**

Unit test for Dem, and integration test for checking that it's working with the GPS sensor.

**Coverage**

Dem.cc has 100% function coverage and 81% condition coverage.

**Tutorial**

There's a new [DEM tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/3.0/gazebo_dem) for Gazebo 3.0.
update.title: DEM support

content.raw: @caguero and I discussed this in person and decided to leave the code in place for now and create an issue to respect the `<gui><camera><pose>` tag from the world file (possibly by setting a flag in the UserCamera if a message was received from the `~/gui` topic).
content.html: @caguero and I discussed this in person and decided to leave the code in place for now and create an issue to respect the <gui><camera><pose> tag from the world file (possibly by setting a flag in the UserCamera if a message was received from the ~/gui topic).

content.raw:
Interesting! I didn't know about that. The main reason to include this code here is because if the user camera is below the surface, you probably won't see anything. It's even worst than that because you'll see a transparent terrain (nothing) and you might thing that there's a problem with the heightmap.

When using <size> is easy to set a valid <gui><camera><pose> because you know the maximum height. When using a DEM file with the true dimensions is more difficult because you probably don't know the elevation.

So, one option is only override the user camera position if there is no <gui><camera><pose> in the world file.
content.html:
Interesting! I didn't know about that. The main reason to include this code here is because if the user camera is below the surface, you probably won't see anything. It's even worst than that because you'll see a transparent terrain (nothing) and you might thing that there's a problem with the heightmap.

When using <size> is easy to set a valid <gui><camera><pose> because you know the maximum height. When using a DEM file with the true dimensions is more difficult because you probably don't know the elevation.

So, one option is only override the user camera position if there is no <gui><camera><pose> in the world file.

content.raw: Will this over-ride the user camera pose specified in a world file with the `<gui><camera><pose>` tag? See [sdf/worlds/joint_damping_demo.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/7c5787779908c1f00f4aba331656b001adaafe7c/sdf/worlds/joint_damping_demo.world?at=default#cl-4) for an example.
content.html: Will this over-ride the user camera pose specified in a world file with the <gui><camera><pose> tag? See sdf/worlds/joint_damping_demo.world for an example.

content.raw:
there is an umet dependency problem when I tried to install `libgdal1-dev`. Mainly because it depends on `libcurl4-gnutls-dev` which conflicts with the openssl version `libcurl4-openssl-dev` that gazebo uses. 

I think swtiching the libcurl version would resolve the problem but that means we will need to consider dropping curl ssl support for our model database connection.
content.html:
there is an umet dependency problem when I tried to install libgdal1-dev. Mainly because it depends on libcurl4-gnutls-dev which conflicts with the openssl version libcurl4-openssl-dev that gazebo uses.

I think swtiching the libcurl version would resolve the problem but that means we will need to consider dropping curl ssl support for our model database connection.

```
#!c++
```

```
gazebo sdf/worlds/heightmap_dem.world

```

**Test**

Unit test for Dem, and integration test for checking that it's working with the GPS sensor.

**Coverage**

Dem.cc has 100% function coverage and 81% condition coverage.

**Tutorial**

There's a new [DEM tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/3.0/gazebo_dem) for Gazebo 3.0.

content.raw:
I tried to compile without GDAL installed, and `HeightmapShape` class complains that `dem` was not declared. I think the cpp file needs some `#ifdef HAVE_GDAL`.


```
#!c++

/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo3/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc:101:68: error: ‘class gazebo::physics::HeightmapShape’ has no member named ‘dem’
/home/ian/depot/clones/gazebo3/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.cc:113:5: error: ‘dem’ was not declared in this scope
make[2]: *** [gazebo/physics/CMakeFiles/gazebo_physics.dir/HeightmapShape.cc.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
```
